newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOTORCYCLING-JAPAN'S OKADA TAKES POLE POSITION IN 500CC.
newsitem.headline: MOTORCYCLING-JAPAN'S OKADA TAKES POLE POSITION IN 500CC.

text.p: Japan's Tadayuki Okada earned his second pole position of the season on Saturday to start on the front row for Sunday's Japanese 500 cc Grand Prix.
The Honda rider, clocked two minutes 7.952 seconds during the second qualifying practice session at the 5.864 km (3.644 miles) Suzuka circuit.
Okada was just 0.065 seconds ahead of team mate and world champion Michael Doohan, while Spain's Alex Criville came in third.
"Although I am in pole position again, things were not perfect for me as the course condition was not so good...I'll do as much as I can to hang in there," Okada said.
Doohan, who took the provisional pole on Friday by clocking two minutes 12.908 seconds in the rain, said he was not so concerned about finishing second.
"The pole would have been better...But my basic concern was to be on the front row," Doohan said.
"I think tomorrow will be a close race of about six people...it will come down to the last five laps," Doohan said.
Japan's Tetsuya Harada clinched the pole position for the 250cc race, while Japans Noboru Ueda will start in front for the 125cc race.
